alert.note: Alert for Berks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 10:43AM EST until January 14 at 11:30AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Eastern Berks County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 1130 AM EST. * At 1043 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Fleetwood to Adamstown, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 296 and 299. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 42 and 44. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 11. Locations impacted include... Reading, Wyomissing, Birdsboro, Kutztown, Fleetwood, Sinking Spring, Laureldale, Wernersville, Topton, Bally, Bechtelsville, Lyons, New Morgan, Spring Ridge, Shillington, West Reading, Boyertown, Mount Penn, Mohnton, and Kenhorst. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
